Projects (13)
Taxonomic review and cladistic analysis of neotropical spiders of the genus Epicratinus Jocqué & Baert, 2005 (Araneae: Zodariidae) with description of eleven new species
Project
A new taxonomic revision and phylogenetic analysis of the spider genus Epicratinus Jocqué & Baert, 2005 is presented. This analysis is based on a data set including 16 Epicratinus species plus 9 outgroups representing by five related zodariid genera and one of them considered most primitive as the root. These taxa were scored for 49 morphological characters. Parsimony was used as the optimality criterion and a sensitivity analysis was performed using different character weighting concavities. Five unambiguous synapomorphies support the monophyly of Epicratinus. Some internal clades within the genus are well-supported and its relationships are discussed. Epicratinus as recovered includes 16 species, all with males and females. A species identification key and distribution maps are provided for all. New morphological data are also presented for 5 previously described species. All 16 species occur only in the New World. The following specie is transferred to Epicratinus: E. perfidus (Jocqué & Baert), comb. nov. from Tenedos; Epicratinus perfidus Jocqué & Baert comb. nov. are newly synonymized with E. santacruz Grismado & Izquierdo and this last is treated as the junior synonym. Epicratinus petropolitanus Mello-Leitão has the male described for the first time. The following 11 species are newly described: E. zangief Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. pegasus Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. pikachu Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. stitch Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. ehonda Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. anakin Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. vader Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. omegarugal Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. zelda Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil); E. dooku Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil) and E. mauru Gonçalves & Brescovit (Brazil).
View
Phylogeny, systematics, and evolution of the family Uloboridae
Project
Uloboridae is a family of nonvenomous spiders, with an almost worldwide distribution. The purpose of the present study is to carry out a more thorough analysis of uloborid phylogeny based on an extended molecular data set, supplemented by detailed morphological analysis. Based on results of the phylogenetic analysis, wewill carry out a reconstruction of the evolutionary history of the family, correlating molecular and morphological characters, and we will provide formal descriptions. The morphological characters and infraspecific variation will be reexamined and reanalyzed.
